snippet: President Obama portrayed the coming vote in Congress on the deal as the most consequential foreign policy decision for lawmakers since the vote to authorize the invasion of Iraq.
abstract: Pres Obama delivers speech at American University in which he takes critics of Iran nuclear deal to task, portraying vote in Congress to approve deal as equivalent in importance to United States foreign policy as vote to authorize invasion of Iraq in 2003; Obama displays certainty about merits of deal, and disdain for its opponents, and says Republicans are opposing accord due to knee-jerk partisanship.
lead_paragraph: President Obama portrayed the coming vote in Congress on the deal as the most consequential foreign policy decision for lawmakers since the vote to authorize the invasion of Iraq.

headline.main: It’s Either Iran Nuclear Deal or ‘Some Form of War,’ Obama Warns
headline.print_headline: In Blunt Speech, Obama Defends Deal With Iran
